    Tyler A. Clark

    he/him

    UMD affiliated researcher leveraging statistical inference and machine learning into outcome-oriented public policy and business solutions.

    Welcome

    I am a Data Scientist at Cruisebound and an Applied Statistics PhD student at the University of Maryland, College Park .

    I am currently interested in statistical properties of deep neural network models, concentration inequalities, measures of fairness in deep learning, and applications of rank reduction to transformer-based models.

    History

    I received my B.A. in Mathematics and Physics, both with distinction, from Connecticut College in 2019.

    Previously, I was a mathematical modeling researcher at the National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism (START) . My research focused on the application of statistical, computational, and mathematical methodologies to model and analyze the behavior of violent non-state actors, including natural language processing, machine learning, and stochastic processes.
